p: HEV infection develops in most individuals as self-limiting acute hepatitis, with mortality rates of around 1%. However, some individuals may develop fulminant hepatic failure, a severe condition that is frequently fatal. This complication is particularly common when the infection occurs in pregnant women, where mortality rates rise to up to 25% [ 1]. Furthermore, immunocompromised patients may progress to chronic hepatitis following an HEV infection [ 2].
